title: Look Back
focus: Reflecting on the significant life events and experiences that have shaped our identity, faith, and ministry.
description: Look back at the things that have formed you, for better or worse, in your life.
reflection: Reflecting on the significant life events and experiences that have shaped our identity, faith, and ministry is a powerful practice. These events, whether joyful or challenging, have contributed to who we are today and how we perceive our calling. By looking back, we can recognize God's hand in our journey, understand the lessons we've learned, and appreciate the growth we've experienced. This reflection helps us to acknowledge the past, heal from any wounds, and celebrate the milestones that have brought us closer to God. Consider the pivotal moments in your life and how they have influenced your faith and ministry. How has God used these experiences to shape your character and guide your path?
verse: Remember the former things, those of long ago; I am God, and there is no other; I am God, and there is none like me. - Isaiah 46:9 (NIV)
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the journey You have led us on and the events that have shaped us. Help us to reflect on our past with gratitude and understanding, recognizing Your hand in every moment. Heal any wounds that still linger and allow us to celebrate the growth and lessons learned. May our reflections draw us closer to You and strengthen our faith. Guide us as we move forward, using our experiences to serve and honor You. In Jesus' name, we pray. Amen.

reflectionQuestions.prompt: What doubts or questions about your vocational calling are surfacing, and how do they shape your direction?
How do your spiritual gifts align with where God may be leading you next?
What dreams or passions tug at your heart when you imagine the future of your ministry?
Where do you sense God calling you beyond your current role or context?
What impact or “fruit” do you hope your life and ministry will bear in five to ten years?
How might digital rhythms—social media, screen time, notifications—support or distract you as you pursue this vision?

tasks.description: Complete a spiritual-gifts inventory and identify one way to steward your top gift in a new context.
Craft a vision board (digital or physical) mapping key dreams, goals, and people you hope to influence.
Write a letter to yourself five years from now, describing what you’ve learned about calling and legacy.
Interview a leader whose ministry you admire; note the gifts, rhythms, and practices that sustained their vision.
Audit your digital habits for one week—track screen time, app usage, and notification patterns; plan boundaries that protect your forward-looking rhythms.

followUpPrompts.prompt: Which emerging vision or doubt demands your prayerful attention?
How did your gifts inventory clarify or complicate your sense of calling?
What digital boundary shifts will you implement to keep your long-term vision clear?
What first step will you take in the next month toward the future God is inviting you into?
